subtasks.hazard: Negligent discharge due to failure to manipulate the safety mechanism

values: Dragoon's conducted EIB training last year and they will receive refresher training when they arrive at the range.
Safeties (PSG's and former Drill Sergeants) will ensure that trainees properly manipulate the safety mechanisms of the hand grenade.
All participants will conduct training with practice grenades until a safety approves them for a live grenade, prior to throwing a live grenade.
Leadership conducts rehearsals for proper hand grenade handling. Safeties remain vigilant during all ranges.

Ammunition transported correctly in accordance with previously mentioned documents. Ammunition will stay at the designated ASP until distributed correctly (Type, quantity) to Soldiers immediately preparing to enter the lane. Certified Ammo Handler will supervise the distribution and handling of all ammunition.

Grenades will be stored off the ground and practice and live grenades will be stored separately. Concertina Wire will surround the ASP and ammo handlers will ensure there is a "No smoking within 50 ft" sign posted outside of the ASP. There will be two fire extinguishers present.
Any unsafe act will result in a cease fire.

draw.overall_supervision_plan: RSO/OIC will brief all Soldiers on range standards and procedures prior to utilizing the range. RSO will give consistent guidance on all safety related issues.  Medical plan has been rehearsed by all medical teams and a medical transport vehicle will be located on the range at all times. Certified ammunition handlers will control the distribution of ammunition. Any unsafe act will immediately result in a cease fire. Gate guards will be posted at the requisite gates to ensure that no one wanders onto the live fire site. All of these measures will establish the foundation for a deliberately executed hand grenade qualification range.  Recommend for approval.
